issue.title: Offset map data too large warnings
issue.body:
We have been trying to implement the parallel consumer in a high event throughput environment and keep getting the following warnings in our logs:
2023-09-22 12:58:04.360  WARN 13 --- [ pc-broker-poll] i.c.p.s.PartitionState                   : Offset map data too large (size: 7844) to fit in metadata payload hard limit of 4096 - cannot include in commit. Warning: messages might be replayed on rebalance. See kafka.coordinator.group.OffsetConfig#DefaultMaxMetadataSize = 4096 and issue #47

At this point consumption stops for a while and then eventually resumes. I understands what is happening and why consumption stops. However, it defeats the purpose of us using the parallel consumer. We need a steady high consumption rate in order to keep up with the producing rate. If consumption stops we fall behind after each stop more an more. At this point we have 500 events per second producing rate and this is our minimum performance test rate. We want this to go up to 2-4000 EPS. We need the consumer to keep up. Which is why we wanted to use the parallel consumer. We tried lowering the commit interval to 1s. Tried switching to PERIODIC_CONSUMER_SYNC. Didn't help. Couldn't really find any other setting in ParallelConsumerOptions that we could play with that would be relevant. 

We are using the parallel consumer through Spring Kafka and we use the following consumer settings:
`
spring:
  kafka:
    consumer:
      properties:
        enable.auto.commit: true
        fetch.max.bytes: 70000000
        fetch.max.wait.ms: 500
        fetch.min.bytes: 50000
        max.partition.fetch.bytes: 50000000
        max.poll.interval.ms: 600000
        max.poll.records: 40000
        partition.assignment.strategy: org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.RoundRobinAssignor
        receive.buffer.bytes: -1
        send.buffer.bytes: -1
`
We also tried with the default values for these properties just to see if that makes a difference. It does not. We even dropped the producing rate to a 100 events per second and only used 2 parallel consumer threads. No help. Still getting the warning and the consumption stops.

Are we trying to use the parallel consumer for something it wasn't design for? Are there any recommended settings we should try? Any help would be appreciated.

issue.title: parallelConsumer.close() is timing out in 0.5.2.6 and 0.5.2.7 for consumer with set producer, after rebalace
issue.body:
Using "core" parallel consumers, by mistake in one of them when building we are setting producer (which is not used by us).
After updating to from 0.5.2.5 to 0.5.2.7 (but also to 0.5.2.6) we see timeout on following scenario when parallelConsumer.close() is executed:
1. 1st instance of application is starting - parallel consumer is started (setting ordering to unordered, concurrency to 10, consumer connecting to localhost with string deserializers with other defaults, **with producer**, commit interval 5s, commit mode periodic consumer sync) for topic with 2 partitions  - both are assigned.
2. 2nd instance of application is started - parallel consumer is started - gets partition no 1, 1st instance parallel consumer gets instance 1 (using default range assignor)
3. 1st application is being closed, parallelConsumer.close() but fails to close in 20 seconds and throws exception

This happens only in 0.5.2.6 and 0.5.2.7 and only if producer is set in parallel consumer options when building parallel consumer.
If producer is not set closing works.

comment.body:
Hi,

I have recreated the bug and identified the root cause - i will try to work out a fix and do a PR in the coming week or so.
It is isolated only to setup when non-transactional Producer is set (even if it is not used).

issue.title: Parrallel consumer stuck in infinite rebalance
issue.body:
Hi,

I have a quite complexe issue with the 2 latest versions 0.5.2.6 and 0.5.2.7 while everything works correctly in 0.5.2.5. 

When the cpu increase we add machine to distribute the load between them. This obviously trigger a rebalance.
With 0.5.2.6 or 0.5.2.7, the rebalance is so long (> 5 min) that something seems to be blocking a correct rebalance.

I don't see anything particularly meaningful in kafka consumer logs

But I see a lot of _"isPoolQueueLow(): Max loading factor steps reached: 100/100"_ and _"Error committing offsets : Offset commit cannot be completed since the consumer is undergoing a rebalance for auto partition assignment. You can try completing the rebalance by calling poll() and then retry the operation."_ which are quite expected since the rebalance is stuck. 

Fixing the number of machine and restarting solve the issue so I was expecting the fix of https://github.com/confluentinc/parallel-consumer/issues/606 to solve this but unfortunally this was not the case. 

I don't now which logs or metrics may be of use to solve or explain this. 
Feel free to ask for more informations.

Regards
Benoît

comment.body: I have recreated the issue with producer set but not used - like in the #648 issue - can you please check if you have same setup - producer is set but not used ?

issue.title: Parrallel consumer stuck in infinite rebalance
issue.body:
Hi,

I have a quite complexe issue with the 2 latest versions 0.5.2.6 and 0.5.2.7 while everything works correctly in 0.5.2.5. 

When the cpu increase we add machine to distribute the load between them. This obviously trigger a rebalance.
With 0.5.2.6 or 0.5.2.7, the rebalance is so long (> 5 min) that something seems to be blocking a correct rebalance.

I don't see anything particularly meaningful in kafka consumer logs

But I see a lot of _"isPoolQueueLow(): Max loading factor steps reached: 100/100"_ and _"Error committing offsets : Offset commit cannot be completed since the consumer is undergoing a rebalance for auto partition assignment. You can try completing the rebalance by calling poll() and then retry the operation."_ which are quite expected since the rebalance is stuck. 

Fixing the number of machine and restarting solve the issue so I was expecting the fix of https://github.com/confluentinc/parallel-consumer/issues/606 to solve this but unfortunally this was not the case. 

I don't now which logs or metrics may be of use to solve or explain this. 
Feel free to ask for more informations.

Regards
Benoît

comment.body:
Hi, @pleszczy

Can you please provide details of your setup, configuration, steps to recreate?
Kafka Broker version
PC Version and config - i.e. Ordering, is Producer used?, transactions enabled / disabled, anything else you feel might be relevant?
I could not reproduce in test environment so far.

Yeah, let me explain here since `RetryHandler` need `ShardManager` and `Clock` from `PCModule` at the same time.
Therefore it seems redundant to make `ShardManager` and `Clock` passed as the arguments.

pull_request.title: improvement: add RetryHandler for accelerating available container count calculation
pull_request.body:
![image](https://github.com/confluentinc/parallel-consumer/assets/1255306/d3924666-1a7d-42ec-84f8-80a340b0b4dd)

Description...
This PR is to improve available work container number calculation.  (from idea of Antony PR #530)
Previously the available worker is due to 3 factors
1.  `inFlight` is false
2. `maybeUserFunctionSucceeded` is false
3. ready to retry

for `inFlight`, it will be set to true after picked up to be executed.
for `maybeUserFunctionSucceeded`, it will be only true after executed and successfully.
We could see (1)/(2) are overlapped, therefore we need to take care of the retry timing.

---
The idea is :
1. implementing a working thread to update the available count and update the `retryQueue`
2. increasing the count when the worker is ready to retry
3. change `retryQueue` to heap to enable quick access for nearest retry worker

The `availableWorkContainerCnt` will be affected in:
1. controlLoop , to add / remove work containers
2. onPartitionRemoved in PartitionStateManager, to remove incompleteoffsets which could be available to execute.

---
The improvement is substantial. The performance of `lessKeysThanThreads ` has been improvement from `01:24` -> `00:40`

---

### Checklist

- [ ] Documentation (if applicable)
- [x] Changelog

repo.name: parallel-consumer
repo.description: Parallel Apache Kafka client wrapper with per message ACK, client side queueing, a simpler consumer/producer API with key concurrency and extendable non-blocking IO processing.

repo.description: Parallel Apache Kafka client wrapper with per message ACK, client side queueing, a simpler consumer/producer API with key concurrency and extendable non-blocking IO processing.

issue.title: Parrallel consumer stuck in infinite rebalance
issue.body:
Hi,

I have a quite complexe issue with the 2 latest versions 0.5.2.6 and 0.5.2.7 while everything works correctly in 0.5.2.5. 

When the cpu increase we add machine to distribute the load between them. This obviously trigger a rebalance.
With 0.5.2.6 or 0.5.2.7, the rebalance is so long (> 5 min) that something seems to be blocking a correct rebalance.

I don't see anything particularly meaningful in kafka consumer logs

But I see a lot of _"isPoolQueueLow(): Max loading factor steps reached: 100/100"_ and _"Error committing offsets : Offset commit cannot be completed since the consumer is undergoing a rebalance for auto partition assignment. You can try completing the rebalance by calling poll() and then retry the operation."_ which are quite expected since the rebalance is stuck. 

Fixing the number of machine and restarting solve the issue so I was expecting the fix of https://github.com/confluentinc/parallel-consumer/issues/606 to solve this but unfortunally this was not the case. 

I don't now which logs or metrics may be of use to solve or explain this. 
Feel free to ask for more informations.

Regards
Benoît

comment.body: We've observed this issue in the last two versions. At the moment, we've put in place a health check to restart pods that experience stuck parallel-consume. However, would greatly appreciate a permanent solution.

issue.title: Move LongPollingMockConsumer to main artefact
issue.body: It's too difficult to use as test artefact.

comment.body:
Any update on this? 

Having to copy paste this code in each project and maintain it is annoying. It would be great if clients could just depend on it.

issue.title: After rebalance, consumers are not re-joining the consumer group.
issue.body:
I have a service running in K8s that is consuming from a Kafka topic. When a new pod comes up, this triggers a rebalance which seems to kick old consumers out of the consumer group. I have 16 pods / consumers running, but after a new pod comes up I can have only 1 consumer (consuming all partitions) and my 15 other pods are idle.

When this new pod comes up, the existing consumers have messages like the following in the logs:
```
22:33:44.055 [INFO] [org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.internals.AbstractCoordinator:1072] [pc-broker-poll] - [Consumer instanceId=6588bffbc4-nnnzc, clientId=consumer-my-consumer-6588bffbc4-nnnzc, groupId=my-consumer] Request joining group due to: group is already rebalancing
22:33:44.055 [INFO] [org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.internals.ConsumerCoordinator:338] [pc-broker-poll] - [Consumer instanceId=6588bffbc4-nnnzc, clientId=consumer-my-consumer-6588bffbc4-nnnzc, groupId=my-consumer] Revoke previously assigned partitions my-topic-12, my-topic-13, my-topic-14
22:33:47.160 [INFO] [org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.internals.AbstractCoordinator:1072] [kafka-coordinator-heartbeat-thread | my-consumer] - [Consumer instanceId=6588bffbc4-nnnzc, clientId=consumer-my-consumer-6588bffbc4-nnnzc, groupId=my-consumer] Request joining group due to: group is already rebalancing
...(5 mins of repeated logs)
22:38:41.699 [INFO] [org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.internals.AbstractCoordinator:1072] [kafka-coordinator-heartbeat-thread | my-consumer] - [Consumer instanceId=6588bffbc4-nnnzc, clientId=consumer-my-consumer-6588bffbc4-nnnzc, groupId=my-consumer] Request joining group due to: group is already rebalancing
22:38:44.103 [WARN] [org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.internals.AbstractCoordinator$HeartbeatThread:1481] [kafka-coordinator-heartbeat-thread | my-consumer] - [Consumer instanceId=6588bffbc4-nnnzc, clientId=consumer-my-consumer-6588bffbc4-nnnzc, groupId=my-consumer] consumer poll timeout has expired. This means the time between subsequent calls to poll() was longer than the configured max.poll.interval.ms, which typically implies that the poll loop is spending too much time processing messages. You can address this either by increasing max.poll.interval.ms or by reducing the maximum size of batches returned in poll() with max.poll.records.
22:38:44.103 [INFO] [org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.internals.AbstractCoordinator:1025] [kafka-coordinator-heartbeat-thread | my-consumer] - [Consumer instanceId=6588bffbc4-nnnzc, clientId=consumer-my-consumer-6588bffbc4-nnnzc, groupId=my-consumer] Resetting generation and member id due to: consumer pro-actively leaving the group
22:38:44.103 [INFO] [org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.internals.AbstractCoordinator:1072] [kafka-coordinator-heartbeat-thread | my-consumer] - [Consumer instanceId=6588bffbc4-nnnzc, clientId=consumer-my-consumer-6588bffbc4-nnnzc, groupId=my-consumer] Request joining group due to: consumer pro-actively leaving the group
```

The `Request joining group due to: group is already rebalancing` message is repeated for around 5 mins. My messages are very quick to process (< 25ms with default max.poll.records) and we did not hit this issue previously in `0.5.2.5`.

Is there a regression in one of the two recent versions that may cause this?

issue.title: After rebalance, consumers are not re-joining the consumer group.
issue.body:
I have a service running in K8s that is consuming from a Kafka topic. When a new pod comes up, this triggers a rebalance which seems to kick old consumers out of the consumer group. I have 16 pods / consumers running, but after a new pod comes up I can have only 1 consumer (consuming all partitions) and my 15 other pods are idle.

When this new pod comes up, the existing consumers have messages like the following in the logs:
```
22:33:44.055 [INFO] [org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.internals.AbstractCoordinator:1072] [pc-broker-poll] - [Consumer instanceId=6588bffbc4-nnnzc, clientId=consumer-my-consumer-6588bffbc4-nnnzc, groupId=my-consumer] Request joining group due to: group is already rebalancing
22:33:44.055 [INFO] [org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.internals.ConsumerCoordinator:338] [pc-broker-poll] - [Consumer instanceId=6588bffbc4-nnnzc, clientId=consumer-my-consumer-6588bffbc4-nnnzc, groupId=my-consumer] Revoke previously assigned partitions my-topic-12, my-topic-13, my-topic-14
22:33:47.160 [INFO] [org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.internals.AbstractCoordinator:1072] [kafka-coordinator-heartbeat-thread | my-consumer] - [Consumer instanceId=6588bffbc4-nnnzc, clientId=consumer-my-consumer-6588bffbc4-nnnzc, groupId=my-consumer] Request joining group due to: group is already rebalancing
...(5 mins of repeated logs)
22:38:41.699 [INFO] [org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.internals.AbstractCoordinator:1072] [kafka-coordinator-heartbeat-thread | my-consumer] - [Consumer instanceId=6588bffbc4-nnnzc, clientId=consumer-my-consumer-6588bffbc4-nnnzc, groupId=my-consumer] Request joining group due to: group is already rebalancing
22:38:44.103 [WARN] [org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.internals.AbstractCoordinator$HeartbeatThread:1481] [kafka-coordinator-heartbeat-thread | my-consumer] - [Consumer instanceId=6588bffbc4-nnnzc, clientId=consumer-my-consumer-6588bffbc4-nnnzc, groupId=my-consumer] consumer poll timeout has expired. This means the time between subsequent calls to poll() was longer than the configured max.poll.interval.ms, which typically implies that the poll loop is spending too much time processing messages. You can address this either by increasing max.poll.interval.ms or by reducing the maximum size of batches returned in poll() with max.poll.records.
22:38:44.103 [INFO] [org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.internals.AbstractCoordinator:1025] [kafka-coordinator-heartbeat-thread | my-consumer] - [Consumer instanceId=6588bffbc4-nnnzc, clientId=consumer-my-consumer-6588bffbc4-nnnzc, groupId=my-consumer] Resetting generation and member id due to: consumer pro-actively leaving the group
22:38:44.103 [INFO] [org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.internals.AbstractCoordinator:1072] [kafka-coordinator-heartbeat-thread | my-consumer] - [Consumer instanceId=6588bffbc4-nnnzc, clientId=consumer-my-consumer-6588bffbc4-nnnzc, groupId=my-consumer] Request joining group due to: consumer pro-actively leaving the group
```

The `Request joining group due to: group is already rebalancing` message is repeated for around 5 mins. My messages are very quick to process (< 25ms with default max.poll.records) and we did not hit this issue previously in `0.5.2.5`.

Is there a regression in one of the two recent versions that may cause this?

comment.body:
@rkolesnev - this looks to be the same issue as https://github.com/confluentinc/parallel-consumer/issues/648. When we remove the `.producer(kafkaProducer)` from our builder, the issue goes away.

I will close this issue in favor of https://github.com/confluentinc/parallel-consumer/issues/648, which has some steps to re-produce.

pull_request.title: improvement: add RetryHandler for accelerating available container count calculation
pull_request.body:
![image](https://github.com/confluentinc/parallel-consumer/assets/1255306/d3924666-1a7d-42ec-84f8-80a340b0b4dd)

Description...
This PR is to improve available work container number calculation.  (from idea of Antony PR #530)
Previously the available worker is due to 3 factors
1.  `inFlight` is false
2. `maybeUserFunctionSucceeded` is false
3. ready to retry

for `inFlight`, it will be set to true after picked up to be executed.
for `maybeUserFunctionSucceeded`, it will be only true after executed and successfully.
We could see (1)/(2) are overlapped, therefore we need to take care of the retry timing.

---
The idea is :
1. implementing a working thread to update the available count and update the `retryQueue`
2. increasing the count when the worker is ready to retry
3. change `retryQueue` to heap to enable quick access for nearest retry worker

The `availableWorkContainerCnt` will be affected in:
1. controlLoop , to add / remove work containers
2. onPartitionRemoved in PartitionStateManager, to remove incompleteoffsets which could be available to execute.

---
The improvement is substantial. The performance of `lessKeysThanThreads ` has been improvement from `01:24` -> `00:40`

---

### Checklist

- [ ] Documentation (if applicable)
- [x] Changelog

repo.name: parallel-consumer
repo.description: Parallel Apache Kafka client wrapper with per message ACK, client side queueing, a simpler consumer/producer API with key concurrency and extendable non-blocking IO processing.
